text: Write the missing numbers: [ ] + 0.3 = 1 and 1 - [ ] = 0.6

Using a number line for 231 + 467, the jumps are +400, +60, and +7. What are the intermediate values?
A regular pentagon has sides of 4.5 cm. Find the perimeter.
Round 1846 to the nearest 100.
explanation: 46 is less than 50, so round down.

text: A coat label says: 35% wool, 35% cotton and the rest is silk. What percentage is silk?

The temperature in Rome is 16 °C. It is 20 degrees colder in Moscow. What is the temperature in Moscow?
Hassan throws a fair six-sided dice (1-6). What is the likelihood he throws a 7?
explanation: A standard dice only goes up to 6.

text: A shopkeeper has 311 oranges. 15 are bad. He packs the rest equally into 8 boxes. How many oranges in each box?
Jamila says: My shape has exactly 3 pairs of parallel lines. Name the shape.
explanation: A regular hexagon has 3 pairs of parallel sides.

text: Carlos says, 'My shape has exactly 4 pairs of perpendicular lines.' Name the shape Carlos is thinking of.
explanation: A square has 4 pairs of perpendicular sides.

text: A lighthouse flashes every 20 seconds. How many times will it flash in one hour?

What is the most likely mass of a baby?
explanation: 2.3 kg is a typical weight for a baby

text: Arrange in descending order: 60136, 306016, 631600, 100663.
explanation: Compare the value of each number place.

text: Which pair of decimals rounds to the same whole number?
Can a whole number ending in zero always be divided exactly by 5?
explanation: All multiples of 10 are also multiples of 5.

text: If 354 x 4 = 1416, how can you calculate 354 x 12?
explanation: Since 12 is 4 x 3, multiply the result by 3.

text: What is the result of 27 divided by 5?
explanation: 27 divided by 5 is 5 with a remainder of 2.

text: Find the missing numbers in the sequence: _, 2, 4, 8, 16, _

Safia's book has 136 pages. She has read 1/8 of it. How many pages has she read?
Points A, B, C are on a line. BC = 3 * AB. If BC = 45 cm, what is the distance from A to C?
Mia says three odd numbers add up to 40. Why is she incorrect?
options: The sum of three odd numbers is always odd.
The sum of three odd numbers is always even.
Odd numbers cannot be added together.
explanation: Odd + Odd + Odd = Odd. 40 is even.

text: A 5m square pond is dug in a 12m square of grass. Calculate the area of grass that is left.
Oliver thinks of a square number between 40 and 100. He adds 4 and gets a multiple of 5. What was his number?

A clock shows 06:57:20. Write the time five minutes later.

Which two numbers from {28, -128, -28} have a total of 0?
Which of these statements is true for both a square and a regular pentagon?
explanation: Both are closed shapes with straight sides.

text: There are 20 fruit trees. 2/5 are apple trees and the rest are pear trees. How many pear trees are there?
Lily rolls a fair 1-6 dice. Which two events have the same likelihood?
options: Rolling 4, 5 or 6 and rolling an odd number
explanation: Both events have a probability of 1/2.

text: Oliver thinks of two whole numbers. One is 1/3 of the other. Their sum is 16. What are the numbers?
Mia uses half as much butter as flour. She uses 450g of flour. How many grams of butter does she use?
Which of these numbers rounds to 5 when rounded to the nearest whole number?

explanation: 339 divided by 6 is 56 with a remainder of 3.

text: Oliver thinks more people like apples than pears. What information must he collect to find out if he is correct?
options: People who like apples and pears
explanation: He must compare the count for both fruits.

text: Which number are all these values divisible by: 150, 625, 400, 175, 225?
Hassan has digit cards 0-8. He picks one. Which of these outcomes is the least likely?
explanation: 9 is not in the set, so probability is zero.

text: Why should dots on a graph showing methods of travel not be connected by lines?
options: It shows a trend over time

text: A square tile is 1/4 shaded. Yuri joins 3 tiles to make a rectangle. What percentage of the rectangle is shaded?
explanation: 1/4 of the total area remains shaded.

text: Which number are all these values divisible by: 150, 625, 400, 175, 225?
Gabriella scores 6, 5 and 4 goals in her matches. What was her team's highest score?
explanation: 6 is the highest value in the set {6, 5, 4}.

text: Gabriella scores 6, 5 and 4 goals in her matches. How many times did her team score no goals?
explanation: The score 0 does not appear in the results.

text: Naomi counts back in sevens: 27, 20, 13... What are the next three numbers in her sequence?
Which of these events takes less than 1 second to complete?
explanation: Clapping takes a fraction of a second.

text: Rajiv says if a sum is even, both numbers must be even. Which addition proves him wrong?
explanation: 3 and 5 are odd, but their sum 8 is even.

text: What number is five-tenths more than 4.79?

explanation: The sequence decreases by 9 each time: 1 - 9 = -8

text: Find the median of these run times: 32, 31, 28, 25, 30, 31.

What type of fruit do you like?
How many pieces of fruit do you eat?
explanation: Buying intent is best for business planning.

text: Chen shares 1/2 a tub of ice cream equally into 4 bowls. What fraction of the whole tub is in each bowl?

text: Rajiv shares 3 bags of food equally between 10 donkeys. What fraction of a bag does each donkey get?
Anastasia draws two lines inside an octagon to make two triangles and a third shape. What is the name of the third shape?
explanation: Octagon with 2 triangles removed leaves a hexagon.

text: What is 24.5 rounded to the nearest whole number?
explanation: 0.5 rounds up to the next whole number.

text: Identify all the prime numbers between 25 and 40.
explanation: 29, 31, 37 are the only primes in this range.

text: Gabriella adds 11 tiles to a square to make a new, larger square. How many tiles does the new square have?
explanation: A 6x6 square (36) is 11 more than a 5x5 square.

explanation: 0.5 rounds up to the next whole number.

options: What is your favourite flavour of chips?

text: What is the result of the calculation 3 x 5 x 7?

explanation: The sequence decreases by 7 each time: -1 - 7 = -8.

explanation: Southwest is the opposite of Northeast.

explanation: Must be 15xx, tens < 5. Largest odd digits: 1539.

text: Youssef throws 16.37m. Mike throws 2.64m further. Oliver throws 4.36m less than Mike. Calculate Oliver's throw distance.

explanation: Angles on a straight line sum to 180 degrees.

explanation: Rearranging parts does not change the total area.

text: Rajiv records data using tally marks for groups of hops. How could he improve the way he records his data?
options: Change the color of the tallies
explanation: A frequency column makes the totals easy to read.

explanation: Yuri must be even and > 15. 16 is possible.

text: Two square tiles with whole number sides have a total area of 52 cm2. What is the perimeter of the shape they form?
explanation: Tiles are 4x4 and 6x6. Perimeter is 32 cm.

text: Two angles join to make a straight line. One angle is 35 degrees. Calculate the other angle.
explanation: Angles on a straight line sum to 180 degrees.

text: A number plus 7 is > 30, and the number minus 7 is < 20. Write all the possible values for the number.
explanation: The number must be between 23 and 27.

text: What are the first three triangular numbers?
explanation: They are formed by adding 1, then 2, then 3.

text: Eva shares 1/2 litre of juice equally into 5 glasses. How much is in each glass?

explanation: A cylinder has 2 circular faces and 1 curved side.

text: A sequence starts 18, ..., ..., ..., ..., 53 with steps of constant size. What is the next number in the sequence?

explanation: A scalene triangle has no lines of symmetry.

explanation: 3 months is max 92 days. 14 weeks is 98 days.

explanation: 5.2 has the highest ones place value.

text: A bag has 10 balls. For every black ball, there are 2 white balls. There is 1 pink ball. How many white balls are there?

explanation: Clapping is a very quick action.

explanation: Two identical isosceles right triangles make a square.

text: Yuri uses 20 counters to show two square numbers. Which two square numbers does he use?
explanation: 4 and 16 are square numbers that sum to 20.

text: Point A is (1, 5) and B is (1, 2). Point C is the same distance from A as B. What is a possible coordinate for C?
explanation: AB distance is 3. (1, 8) is 3 units from A.

explanation: Probability depends on location and context.
